snippet: Investment houses are moving jobs, mostly those of middle-tier staff members, out of the New York area to places like North Carolina, Salt Lake City and Jacksonville, Fla.
abstract: New York’s biggest investment houses are shifting jobs out of the area and expanding into cheaper locales in the United States, threatening the vast middle tier of positions that form the backbone of employment on Wall Street; shift comes even as banks consider deeper staff cuts here, which could undermine the state and city tax base long term; consultants say they have seen a sharp pickup in this trend, known as near-shoring.
lead_paragraph: Investment houses are moving jobs, mostly those of middle-tier staff members, out of the New York area to places like North Carolina, Salt Lake City and Jacksonville, Fla.

headline.seo: Midlevel Finance Jobs Leave Wall Street as Firms Cut Costs
headline.main: Financial Giants Are Moving Jobs Off Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Financial Giants Are Moving Jobs Off Wall Street
